contentrichtext.text: '''H.245''' is a control channel [[Communications protocol|protocol]] used with[in] e.g. [[H.323]] and [[H.324]] communication sessions, and involves the line transmission of non-[[telephone]] signals. It also offers the possibility to be tunneled within [[H.225.0]] call signaling messages. This eases [[firewall (networking)|firewall]] traversing. H.245 is capable of conveying information needed for multimedia communication, such as [[encryption]], [[flow control (data)|flow control]], [[jitter]] management, preference requests, as well as the opening and closing of logical channels used to carry media streams. It also defines separate ''send'' and ''receive'' capabilities and the means to send these details to other devices that support H.323. ==Handshake issues== One major drawback within the initial version of H.323 was the lengthy, four-way H.245 protocol [[handshaking|handshake]] required during the opening up the logical channels of a telephony session. Later versions of H.323 introduced the ''Fast Connect'' procedure, using the fastStart element of an H.225.0 message. Fast Connect brought the negotiation down to a two-way handshake. Another recommendation, [[H.460.6]], Extended Fast Connect Feature, exists that defines a one-way handshake. ==External links== * [http://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-H.245/en ITU-T H.245 Recommendation] [[Category:ITU-T recommendations]] [[Category:Videotelephony]]
